Silicon Software Runtime 5 Documentation

Image Acquisition with microEnable IV Frame Grabbers
(Camera Link, LVDS and GigE Vision)

Content

Getting Started
microEnable 4 Camera Link & LVDS
microEnable 4 GigE Vision
microEnable 5


Introduction
Getting started with Applets


Real-time on-board image processing functions running on Silicon Software frame grabbers are implemented via applets. This section gives an introduction into the world of applets and the availability of different types of applets for certain frame grabber models.

Image Acquisition with microEnable IV Camera Link and LVDS Frame Grabbers



Advanced AcquisitionApplets & Features



This section lists all Advanced AcquisitionApplets and features available for the following frame grabber models:

  • microEnable IV AD4-CL
  • microEnable IV AD4-PoCL
  • microEnable IV AD4-LVDS
  • microEnable IV VD4-CL
  • microEnable IV VD4-PoCL

Acquisition Applets & Features


This section lists all AcquisitionApplets and features available for the following frame grabber models:

  • microEnable IV AS1-PoCL
  • microEnable IV AD1-CL
  • microEnable IV AD1-PoCL
  • microEnable IV AD1-mPoCL
  • microEnable IV VD1-CL
  • microEnable IV AD4-CL
  • microEnable IV AD4-PoCL
  • microEnable IV AD4-LVDS
  • microEnable IV VD4-CL
  • microEnable IV VD4-PoCL
The microEnable Trigger System


Following this link you learn how to setup, configure, and control a synchronized image acquisition task based on the powerful Silicon Software trigger implementation.
Camera Link Camera Configuration


This section describes how the configuration of Camera Link cameras (using vendor tools) is supported - based on the serial communication interface. You also learn how to configure your camera with Silicon Software's shell tool clshell.

Image Acquisition with microEnable IV GigE Vision Frame Grabbers

Advanced AcquisitionApplets & Features


This section lists all Advanced AcquisitionApplets and features available for the following frame grabber models:

  • microEnable IV AQ4-GE
  • microEnable IV AQ4-GPoE
  • microEnable IV VQ4-GE
  • microEnable IV VQ4-GPoE

Acquisition Applets & Features


This section lists all AcquisitionApplets and features available for the following frame grabber models:

  • microEnable IV AQ4-GE
  • microEnable IV AQ4-GPoE
  • microEnable IV VQ4-GE
  • microEnable IV VQ4-GPoE
The microEnable Trigger System


Following this link you learn how to setup, configure, and control a synchronized image acquisition task based on the powerful Silicon Software trigger implementation.
GigE Vision Camera Configuration
- GenICam Explorer


With the GigE Vision standard, configuration and control of GigE Vision cameras is fully standardized. Silicon Software provides the GUI tool GenICam Explorer that can be used to configure any GigE Vision based camera connected to a Silicon Software GigE Vision frame grabber - camera vendor independent.

Image Acquisition with microEnable 5 Frame Grabbers


The applet sets for image acquisition with microEnable 5 frame grabbers are not part of this runtime installation. If you want to use microEnable 5 frame grabbers, install runtime version 5.3 or higher, together with the according applet sets.
